Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: project scaffolding, data, and five analysis stubs

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix methodology issues across 8 analyses and update findings

- Analysis 03: Use trailing-12-month OTP and post-COVID slope \(2022+\)
  instead of all-time averages and full-period slope through COVID
- Analysis 05: Exclude current month from rolling baseline \(lagged
  window\) to prevent self-dampening of z-scores; 842 anomalies flagged
- Analysis 06: Add 12-month centered rolling mean detrending and 3-year
  minimum data filter for route-level seasonal analysis
- Analysis 07: Add bus-only stratification with scipy p-values,
  confirming r=-0.50 \(p<0.001\) survives Simpson''s paradox check
- Analysis 10: Fix SUM\(trips_wd\) to MAX\(trips_wd\) for peak frequency;
  correlation collapses from r=-0.39 to r=0.02 \(was confounded artifact\)
- Analysis 11: Include IB,OB stops in both directions, use MAX per
  direction, exclude one-direction routes; max asymmetry drops to 0.077
- Analysis 04: Replace look-ahead quintile assignment with rolling
  12-month per-neighborhood OTP and per-month quintile ranks
- Analysis 02: Add route counts to mode comparison legends
- Add scipy>=1.14 dependency for correlation p-values
- Add docs/METHODOLOGY-ISSUES.md documenting all issues and fixes
- Update all affected FINDINGS.md files with corrected results

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
